intro: Praravinia montana, commonly known as mountain praravinia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slight fragrance. Praravinia montana is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
